This column tracks the number of users who viewed banners in the growth tracking system, specifically used for measuring banner exposure in the New PTS Banner 2.0 feature tracking dashboard, despite being named "clicks". Used consistently across multiple dashboards for banner view measurement.

A unique string identifier for customers in the Paytm payments system, used to link customer records across various payment-related activities and features like bank linking, UPI transactions, and widget usage.
A timestamp column that tracks when the record was last updated or loaded into the data lake, commonly used for filtering recent data and temporal analysis in user engagement tracking.
A date column that represents the transaction or event date, commonly used for temporal filtering and partitioning in payment-related analytics and growth tracking dashboards.
Records the number of banner impressions or views by users, used to track the reach and exposure of promotional banners in growth marketing campaigns for the Paytm platform.
Date when a user activated UPI Lite service, used for tracking UPI Lite adoption and measuring the effectiveness of banner campaigns promoting this feature.
Unique identifier for marketing banners or promotional displays shown to users, used to track banner performance metrics including user views, clicks, and conversion rates in growth analytics.

This column tracks the number of users who viewed banners in the Paytm payments application, specifically used for measuring banner engagement and conversion funnel analysis in growth tracking features.

A unique identifier for customers in the Paytm payments system, used to track user activities across various banking and payment features such as bank linking, credit card linking, UPI services, and widget usage.
A timestamp column that tracks when the data record was last updated or loaded into the system, commonly used for data freshness validation and to filter historical records in analytical queries.

Date column representing when payment-related events occurred, used as the primary time dimension for tracking user activities like bank linking, credit card linking, and UPI transactions in the spend analytics table.
Tracks the number of users who viewed promotional banners, specifically used for measuring banner impression metrics in growth tracking campaigns for features like the New PTS Banner 2.0.
Date field representing when UPI Lite was activated by a user, used for tracking UPI Lite adoption timelines and measuring conversion events in banner campaigns.

A unique identifier for promotional banners displayed to users, used to track banner performance metrics including views and conversions in the UPI statement download feature campaign tracking system.

Tracks the number of user interactions (likely clicks or views) with promotional banners related to the UPI statement download feature, used for measuring engagement and conversion tracking in growth analytics.
Unique identifier for customers who have downloaded UPI statements, used for tracking user engagement and conversion analysis across payment features and banner interactions.
Timestamp indicating when the receive money widget data record was last updated or processed in the data pipeline, used for tracking feature adoption and ensuring data freshness in analytics.

Represents the date when a user downloaded their UPI statement from the Paytm payments platform. This date field is used to track user engagement with statement download features and analyze conversion patterns over time.
Tracks the number of banner impressions or views by users for the New PTS (UPI Statement) Banner 2.0 feature, used for measuring banner visibility and engagement in growth tracking analytics.
Date when UPI Lite was activated by the customer, used for tracking growth metrics and conversion analysis in relation to banner engagement and feature adoption.
Identifier for banners displayed to users in the payment system, used to track banner views and conversions for various payment features like receive money widgets and other financial services.
This column tracks the number of users who viewed promotional banners, specifically used in growth tracking dashboards to measure banner impression metrics for the Receive Money widget feature.
Unique identifier for customers who have added the receive money widget to their Paytm payment interface, used to track feature adoption and user engagement with promotional banners.
Records the date when the receive money widget data was last updated or loaded into the system, used for temporal filtering and ensuring data freshness in payment feature analytics.

Date field representing the daily partition or timestamp for tracking Receive Money widget additions and user engagement metrics in the payments system. Used consistently across dashboards for temporal analysis and daily data partitioning.
Number of users who viewed the banner for the Receive Money widget feature, used to track engagement and measure the reach of banner campaigns in the payments application.
Date field representing when UPI Lite activation occurred for users, used in payment feature tracking and growth analytics for banner conversion analysis.

Unique identifier for promotional banners displayed to users as part of the New PTS Banner 2.0 campaign to drive adoption of the Scan & Pay widget feature. This ID is used to track banner views and measure conversion effectiveness in the growth tracking system.

Tracks the number of clicks on promotional banners or widgets, specifically used in growth tracking dashboards to measure user engagement with New PTS Banner 2.0 features related to payment services and widget adoption.

Unique identifier for customers who have added the Scan & Pay widget to their Paytm payment interface, used to track user engagement and conversion metrics across various payment features and promotional banners.
A date column that tracks when the record was last updated or processed in the data pipeline, used for data lineage and ETL management purposes in the widget analytics tracking system.
Date column representing the daily snapshot date for tracking widget addition events and user engagement metrics in the Scan & Pay widget feature analysis.
This column tracks the number of users who viewed promotional banners for payment features, used to measure banner impression effectiveness in the New PTS Banner 2.0 tracking system.
Date when a user activated their UPI Lite feature, used for tracking user engagement and conversion metrics in relation to promotional banners and feature adoption analytics.

A business-level categorization of UPI transactions that groups detailed flow categories into broader transaction types (P2P, SnP, Online, Onus) for simplified analysis and reporting. This column is used to count distinct use cases per customer and analyze transaction patterns across different payment flows.
The amount column represents the monetary value of UPI payment transactions for gaming merchant 5816, capturing the transaction amounts used in payment flow analysis and merchant revenue tracking.

Categorizes the type of UPI payment flow (e.g., P2P, QR-based payments, online transactions, mandate-based payments) used in transactions, enabling analysis of user payment behavior patterns across different transaction methods in the gaming merchant ecosystem.
A unique identifier for individual UPI transactions, used to track and analyze specific payment events within the gaming merchant payment processing system.

Boolean flag indicating whether a UPI transaction is a Person-to-Merchant (P2M) transaction, used to categorize and analyze payment flows between individual consumers and business merchants in the UPI ecosystem. This field enables business analytics and ratio calculations between P2P (peer-to-peer) and P2M transaction types for comprehensive payment flow analysis.

A boolean flag indicating whether the UPI transaction is a Person-to-Person (P2P) payment between individuals. This column is used to categorize transaction flows and distinguish P2P payments from Person-to-Merchant (P2M) or other transaction types. It enables transaction type classification, pattern analysis, and business metrics calculations across different dashboard contexts for comprehensive UPI transaction analytics.

A categorical field that classifies UPI transactions into different flow types or transaction categories. This field categorizes the type or flow of UPI transactions, serving as a detailed transaction classification that supplements the basic P2P (peer-to-peer) and P2M (peer-to-merchant) categories. Used as a business dimension for analyzing transaction patterns, user engagement metrics, and payment flow analysis across different business intelligence reporting contexts.

Boolean flag indicating whether a UPI transaction is a Person-to-Merchant (P2M) transaction. This column is used to categorize and analyze payment flows, distinguishing merchant payment transactions from peer-to-peer (P2P) transactions. Applied in various analytics including business metrics (DAU ratios, transaction volumes, GMV comparisons between P2P and P2M payment types), engagement metrics analysis, and state-wise transaction analysis across different dashboard contexts.

Boolean flag indicating whether a UPI transaction is peer-to-peer (P2P), used to distinguish personal money transfers from merchant payments (P2M) for transaction categorization, business analysis, reporting, and ratio analysis in UPI payment analytics.

Represents the monetary value of UPI transactions used for customer lifecycle and retention analysis. This amount field is utilized to: (1) calculate GMV (Gross Merchandise Value) buckets for analyzing transaction value segments, (2) measure total transaction volume aggregated at the customer lifecycle snapshot level, and (3) enable segmentation analysis across different states, flow categories, and customer segments for comprehensive transaction volume assessment.

The transaction amount in monetary value for UPI payments, representing the gross merchandise value (GMV) for UPI transactions at the customer lifecycle level. This field is used to calculate Gross Merchandise Value, analyze customer transaction patterns in retention and lifecycle metrics, analyze payment volumes, and calculate ratios between P2P (peer-to-peer) and P2M (peer-to-merchant) transaction values.

Unique identifier for customers who initiate or make UPI payments, serving as the primary key to track customer lifecycle metrics across different time periods. This column is used as a key dimension for analyzing daily active users, calculating retention rates, and distinguishing between P2P (peer-to-peer) vs P2M (peer-to-merchant) transaction patterns in UPI transaction analysis.

Identifier for the UPI payment service provider or bank handle (e.g., 'paytm', 'ptyes', 'ptaxis', 'pthdfc', 'ptsbi') associated with the payer in UPI transactions. This field is used across dashboards to analyze customer retention, transaction patterns, and ratios across different UPI service providers in customer lifecycle analysis and payment provider performance evaluation.

A date key field representing the transaction date, serving as the primary temporal dimension for UPI transaction analysis. This column enables date range filtering and partitioning of transaction data for time-based analysis, supporting customer lifecycle metrics calculations, retention analysis, and P2P vs P2M transaction pattern studies. Used consistently across dashboards for filtering and analyzing UPI transactions within specific time periods.

Categorical field that classifies UPI transactions by their transaction flow type. Distinguishes between 'PAY' transactions (outgoing payments) and 'COLLECT' transactions (incoming money requests). Used in conjunction with P2P and P2M flags to determine whether transactions are person-to-person, person-to-merchant, or other flow categories. Applied for filtering and analyzing customer transaction behavior in lifecycle and retention metrics, as well as for business analytics and state-wise flow analysis.

Unique identifier for each UPI transaction record. Used across dashboards to: (1) count distinct transactions per user for calculating transaction frequency metrics (TPU) in retention and lifecycle analysis, and (2) calculate transaction volumes and ratios between P2P (peer-to-peer) and P2M (peer-to-merchant) payments in customer lifecycle analysis. Essential for all transaction-level analytics and customer behavior tracking.

A date column that represents the snapshot or processing date for UPI transaction records, serving as a temporal dimension for analyzing transaction patterns and trends over time. This field is used for time-based filtering and retention analysis to compare user activity across different time periods, and supports comparative analysis of P2P and P2M transaction metrics in conjunction with other date fields.

The amount column stores the base monetary value for campaign redemptions that gets converted to actual cash burn costs using redemption-type-specific formulas (coins divided by 166.67, goldcoins by 100, UPI plus 0.2478 fee). This column serves as the foundation for calculating campaign financial impact across different reward types.

Identifies the promotional campaign or marketing offer associated with cashback transactions and supercash tasks. This column is used to categorize and analyze performance metrics across different promotional campaigns in the cashback system.
Timestamp indicating when a campaign record was created in the system, used for temporal analysis and reporting in cashback campaign tracking, particularly for UPI-related financial transactions.

A date column that indicates when the record was last updated or loaded into the data lake, used for incremental data processing and filtering records based on their data freshness in the campaign snapshot table.

Indicates the fulfillment stage of cashback rewards, with values representing different states in the reward processing workflow (1=Pending, 2=Processing, 3=Given). This column is used to track and categorize the status of cashback distribution in campaign analytics.
Primary key identifier for campaign snapshot records in the campaign tracking system, used to uniquely identify each campaign snapshot entry for user reward and supercash campaigns.

A JSON field containing metadata and configuration details for cashback campaigns, including scratch card information and transaction-specific data that can be parsed to extract campaign parameters and status indicators.

Specifies the type of cashback redemption method used in campaigns, with values like 'coins', 'goldcoins', and 'upi' that determine different calculation formulas for cashback amounts. This column categorizes how users redeem their rewards and is used to apply appropriate conversion rates for different redemption mechanisms.

A numeric status code that tracks the lifecycle state of promotional campaigns or cashback tasks, where 1 indicates active/processed campaigns and 2 indicates inactive/unscratched campaigns, used in combination with fulfillment_status to determine final reward states.
Timestamp indicating when a campaign snapshot record was last updated, used to track the timing of cashback task modifications and filter records for month-to-date analysis of gratified users.

Unique identifier for users who have participated in cashback campaigns and redemption activities. This column is used to track and count distinct users who have received various types of rewards (coins, goldcoins, UPI cashback) for campaign performance analysis.

The wallet column stores wallet identifier or wallet type information for users participating in promotional campaigns, used to track and analyze user engagement across different payment methods including UPI, coins, and goldcoins redemption systems.

Unique identifier for users participating in the supercash rewards system, used to track distinct users who have received or are eligible for cashback rewards through various redemption methods including UPI transactions.

Represents the base cashback amount in decimal format for supercash tasks, which gets converted using different formulas based on redemption type (coins, goldcoins, or UPI) to calculate the final cashback value displayed in dashboard reports.

Identifies the promotional campaign or marketing initiative associated with each supercash task, used for tracking and analyzing campaign-specific performance metrics like user engagement and cash burn rates.

A calculated monetary value representing the cash equivalent cost of rewards redeemed by users, standardized across different redemption types (coins, goldcoins, UPI) using specific conversion rates. This metric is used to track the total financial impact of promotional campaigns and reward distributions.

Timestamp indicating when a supercash task record was originally created in the system. This field is used for temporal filtering and analysis in promotional campaigns, particularly for month-to-date user activity tracking and historical data segmentation.

A system-generated date field that tracks when each record in the supercash task snapshot was last updated during data pipeline processing, commonly used for filtering data within specific time ranges for analytics and reporting.

Indicates the fulfillment stage of supercash/cashback tasks, where integer values represent different states: 1 (Pending/Unscratched), 2 (Processing), and 3 (Given/Completed). This column is used together with the status field to track the progression of cashback rewards through the fulfillment pipeline.

Unique identifier for each cashback task or transaction record in the supercash system, used to track individual UPI and other payment method cashback rewards through their lifecycle from creation to fulfillment.

A JSON-formatted text field that stores additional metadata and details about supercash tasks and scratch cards, including fields like scratch card ID and scratched status that can be extracted for analysis and reporting.

Specifies the type of redemption method used for supercash rewards (e.g., 'coins', 'goldcoins', 'upi'), which determines the cashburn calculation formula and is used to categorize redemption activities in campaign performance tracking.

Integer status code indicating the current state of a supercash task or cashback transaction, where 1 represents active/processed transactions and 2 represents unscratched/inactive transactions, used in conjunction with fulfillment_status to determine the final transaction state.
Timestamp indicating when the supercash task record was last updated, used to track temporal patterns of cashback reward processing and user gratification events with microsecond precision.

Unique identifier for users who have earned or are eligible for supercash/cashback rewards through various redemption types including UPI transactions. Used to track and count distinct users who have been gratified with cashback in promotional campaigns.

Column used to categorize or filter wallet-related transactions, specifically for UPI (Unified Payments Interface) payment method tracking in the supercash redemption system. This column enables the identification and counting of distinct users engaging with UPI-based wallet transactions.

A JSON field containing metadata about cashback transactions and scratch card details, including properties like scratchCardId and scratched status that are extracted for cashback reward processing and user gratification tracking.

Unique identifier for users in the supercash rewards system, used to track and count distinct users who have received or are eligible for cashback rewards through various redemption methods including UPI transactions.

Represents the total count of users from a previous period (typically last month) that serves as the baseline cohort for calculating user retention rates in UPI transaction analysis. This metric is used as the denominator when measuring what percentage of users continue to transact in subsequent periods.

Represents the count of UPI users who were active in the previous month and continued to be active in the current month-to-date period, used to measure user retention rates across different transaction frequency segments.

Categorizes UPI transactions into different flow types or payment categories, serving as a classification system for transaction flows beyond the basic P2P (peer-to-peer) and P2M (peer-to-merchant) distinctions. This column is used for analyzing transaction patterns and user behavior across different payment flow categories in state-wise and lifecycle analyses.

Boolean flag that identifies Person-to-Merchant (P2M) UPI transactions, used to segment payment flows and calculate P2P vs P2M performance ratios across metrics like daily active users, transaction volumes, and gross merchandise value.

A boolean flag indicating whether a UPI transaction is a peer-to-peer (P2P) payment, used to differentiate P2P transactions from peer-to-merchant (P2M) transactions for business analytics and ratio calculations.

Represents the primary city where a customer has the highest activity or engagement, determined through aggregation of customer transaction and engagement patterns. This field is used for geographical segmentation in UPI customer lifecycle analysis and state-wise flow categorization.

Represents the most popular or frequently used state associated with each customer, derived from customer engagement data and used for geographical segmentation and state-wise analysis of UPI transaction flows and customer lifecycle metrics.

A date field that represents the snapshot date for engagement data, used for temporal filtering and time-series analysis of user activity metrics including daily active users, transactions, and amounts.
